page.title: 05PRISTON V DUNKERTON GAMES
page.content: Following the Mediaeval games in 1984, the 1985 annual match between Priston and Dunkerton took the form of Deck Games on the Titanic held in the meadow by Cam brook. As well as plenty of water; spectators in period dress and cucumber sandwiches for tea added to the atmosphere. Rules of the games take account of local conditions so when one of the 'deck hockey' goals is larger than the other and downhill, the goalie is armed with a hose to compensate. Games varied from Tug o' War to the less well known 'Uckers' which is thought to be a life size version of Ludo. Deck Quoits and a shooting match added to the variety. Games are entered into without thought for life or limb, and indeed the captain of the Priston ladies hockey team ended in hospital, fortunately with nothing worse than six stitches.
